questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator has to forward vCenter Server logs to a syslog server to be retained for security audits.
Which two protocols are available in vCenter Server Appliance VAMI for syslog forwarding? (Choose two.)

A new AD domain has just been added to vSphere as an identity source. This new domain has a user group called administrators group.
Which role do the administrator group users have by default, when authenticated to vCenter Server?

discussion.content:
Must be: D
"The administrator of the vCenter Single Sign-On domain, administrator@vsphere.local by default, the root user, and vpxuser are assigned the Administrator role by default. Other users are assigned the No Access role by default."



https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.security.doc/GUID-93B962A7-93FA-4E96-B68F-AE66D3D6C663.html
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.troubleshooting.doc/GUID-C9A5157F-899B-4E6F-BE76-BA1AA8091EE3.html this would lead to answer D

questions.question_text:
A vSphere administrator has disabled Fault Tolerance on a powered-off VM.
What could cause the VM to fail to power back on?

A customer suspects someone or something is changing the MAC address of a virtual machine.
Which security policy should the customer modify to obtain more information?

discussion.content: Its B as promiscuous mode allows you to obtain more information. If you do MAC Address change option, it will stop the mac addresses from changing but doesn't provide more info on who is changing the mac addresses.

It's B. Key words: "obtain more information" it doesn't say prevent MAC Address changes. Promiscuous Mode will allow you to run wireshark or other analyzer to see who or what is making those MAC changes.

Answer is D - MAC Address Change
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.security.doc/GUID-942BD3AA-731B-4A05-8196-66F2B4BF1ACB.html

If two VM-VM affinity rules are in conflict, you cannot enable both.

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/7.0/com.vmware.vsphere.resmgmt.doc/GUID-69C738B6-5FC8-4189-9CB5-DD90A5A05979.html#:~:text=When%20two%20VM%2DVM%20affinity,than%20violations%20of%20affinity%20rules.

choices.C: Rules are applied based on priority.
choices.A: Only one rule can be enabled.

questions.question_text: What is the outcome when two affinity rules conflict?
